results.title: Fly Peewee, Fly!
results.brief_description: A young Aboriginal boy, Robbie is in the midst of the conflict between his father and his grandmother. Robbie’s grandmother is white and wants to give Robbie every advantage, while Robbie’s aboriginal father is searching for his own identity and place. A warm story about fragile but meaningful family relationships.

results.title: First love
results.brief_description: First Love is a story about 2 teenagers, discovering “first love” and each others bodies. A secret meeting in a school workshop leads to an intimate encounter and the exchange of rings. A tale of discovery, exploration, facination and body piercing that has delighted film festival audiences in Australia, Sweden, Spain and the United States.

results.title: Evictions
results.creator_credit: Richard Lowenstein, Wendy Lowenstein, Lyn Nicolson, Australian Film Commission and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Documentary/drama on police-enforced evictions in Melbourne during the 1930’s depression and the tactics the organised unemployed used at the time to combat the situation. Based on the memories of Noel Counihan and Tom Hills and adapted from the book ‘Weevils in the flour’ by Wendy Lowenstein, the film combines interviews with period reconstruction. Erwin Rado Award for Best Australian Short Fiction, Melbourne Film Festival, 1980.

results.title: Elephant theatre
results.brief_description: Like an Indian pod filled with tiny ivory elephants, the imaginary hand-size theatre fills with elephants, to the delight of the man who built it.

results.title: Dust (On Wheels )
results.brief_description:
Two groups of teenagers - a white brother and sister, and two Aboriginal mates - come together to find work on a dusty cotton field in the outback. What they discover hidden in the ground, is history itself. Switching effortlessly from the naturalism of the relationships between the youth to the grandeur of the mythic power and terror of the resolution, this short film is an exemplary example of contemporary Australian cinema.
Mick is young, white and angry at the world. His sister Amy is trying to keep it all together, not an easy task when Mick seems determined to screw things up. Leroy is afraid his future holds nothing beyond this life in the mirage of a dusty field. His best mate Vance works alongside him, more interested in Amy than chipping weeds. Ruby, Leroy’s mother is the only one who notices when the uneasy sky forces the elements to merge. As a violent dust storm awakes, racial differences must be put aside as the five shelter in Leroy’s car. Australia’s history, black and white, is revealed as the storm unearths the secrets that lie beneath the surface of the land.

results.title: The Drover's wife
results.brief_description: From Henry Lawson via Russell Drysdale - The Australian myth of The Drover’s Wife retold from a different perspective. Story retold by Murray Bail. Based on Henry Lawson’s original story and inspired by Drysdale’s painting of the same name this film explores women’s invisibility in our cultural history. What is so wonderful about this program is not only that it uses a wide variey of commentators and visual and literay sources, but it is positive and free of professional jargon. Cast features Martin Vaughan. Won Silver Award and Special Award for Acting in the General Category at the AFI Awards.

results.title: Prayers of a mother
results.material_description: Multi channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: A video installation that centres around a mother’s prayers for her children. Her hopes and concern for her family are expressed through edited sequences of her children’s faces contrasted by a single image of her hands holding a prayer book and rosary.

results.title: Collectors
results.brief_description: An inventive and funny documentary that looks at various types of collections. Reg collects spark plugs and Margot collects frogs. Even more interesting are the collectors. There is a thriving sub-culture of ‘object hunters’ out there, attending swap meets and fetes in search of that ‘ gem ‘. Some say it’s all in the chase while others prefer the find!

results.title: Code blue
results.creator_credit: Moira Moss, Pascal Guilloux, AFTRS and Andrew O'Sullivan
results.brief_description: A busy intersection in a large city. Everyone is going about their own business - waiting to cross the road, minding their children…A jay-walker is run over by a courier van. How fast can the city heal itself? ‘Code blue’ is a tightly directed and beautifully paced film which has screened at over 20 festivals throughout the world. The film’s blue tones help to create a tense and emotive ten minute journey through a fast city.
